entry.def: A broadside is a strong written or spoken attack on a person or institution.

example.ex: The Social Democratic leader launched a broadside against both monetary and political union.
example.tran: 这位社会民主党领袖对金钱和政治联盟进行了猛烈抨击。

entry.def: If a ship is broadside to something, it has its longest side facing in the direction of that thing.

example.ex: The ship was moored broadside to the pier.

means.word_mean: 1. an advertisement (usually printed on a page or in a leaflet) intended for wide distribution;

sentences.sentence: "he mailed the circular to all subscribers"

means.word_mean: 3. all of the armament that is fired from one side of a warship
4. the whole side of a vessel from stem to stern;

sentences.sentence: "the ship was broadside to the dock"

means.word_mean: 5. the simultaneous firing of all the armament on one side of a warship
1. collide with the broad side of;
1. with a side facing an object;

sentences.sentence: "the wave caught the canoe broadside and capsized it"
